revised_title: Clarification of Formaldehyde, Alcohol, and Acetone Titrations Techniques
tldr: This article clarifies the principles and procedures of formaldehyde, alcohol, and acetone titrations, addressing misunderstandings in the methods used for determining amino and carboxyl groups in various substances. It emphasizes the importance of defining initial and end-points in titration results and distinguishes between two common titration procedures for different analytical purposes.
